intro: Serpicula repens, commonly known as the creeping serpentine, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and has a low, sprawling growth habit. Its leaves are narrow and slightly curled, while its small, white flowers appear in clusters. Serpicula repens is often found in dry, sunny environments and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
